title: Easy Lasagna Recipe
description: This easy lasagna recipe is made with lean ground beef, three types of cheese, and a jar of spaghetti sauce for a hearty, family-pleasing meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Main Dishes Pasta Lasagna Recipes Meat Lasagna Recipes Easy Lasagna 4.6 (1,189) 929 Reviews 243 Photos An easy lasagna recipe that saves me lots of time. This dish satisfies everyone in the family. Try it tonight! Submitted by Joanie Heger Updated on November 12, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 243 243 243 243 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 10 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 9x13-inch lasagna Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Making perfect homemade lasagna doesn’t have to be tedious. This top-rated easy lasagna recipe comes together quickly with a relatively short ingredient list.  Easy Lasagna Ingredients These are the ingredients you’ll need to make this easy lasagna recipe:   Beef: This easy lasagna starts with ground beef. You can use ground turkey for a lighter option.  Spaghetti sauce: Use store-bought or homemade spaghetti sauce.  Cheeses: You’ll need cottage cheese, mozzarella, and Parmesan.  Eggs: Eggs help bind the cheese mixture together. Plus, they lend moisture and richness.  Seasonings: Season the easy lasagna with dried parsley, salt, and black pepper. Lasagna noodles: Of course, you’ll need lasagna noodles! Water: Pour ½ cup of water around the edges of the baking dish before baking.  How to Make Easy Lasagna You’ll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade easy lasagna:  Cook and drain the ground beef, then stir in the spaghetti sauce and simmer. Combine the cottage cheese, 2 cups of mozzarella, eggs, half of the Parmesan, and seasonings.Assemble the lasagna according to the detailed recipe.Bake, covered, for 45 minutes. Uncover and continue baking for 10 minutes.  What to Serve With Easy Lasagna For mouthwatering serving inspiration, explore our collection of Easy Side Dishes for Lasagna. Here are a few of the recipes you’ll find:  Roasted Asparagus and Mushrooms  Garlic Knots Arugula-Fennel Salad  How to Store and Freeze Easy Lasagna Store the cooked lasagna in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to five days. To reheat, cover the leftovers with foil and bake at 350 degrees F for about half an hour, or until the lasagna is heated through and the sauce is bubbly. To freeze, wrap the lasagna in at least one layer of storage wrap and at least one layer of aluminum foil. Freeze for up to three months. Thaw the frozen lasagna in the refrigerator overnight, then follow the reheating instructions above. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “Amazing recipe,” raves one Allrecipes community member. “Loved the simplicity. [I] was able to use gluten-free Barilla noodles and lactose-free cottage cheese to suit our dietary needs. Superb!” “I have made this recipe many, many times and it always turns out PERFECT,” according to Mike Weiner. “It’s easy, it’s fun to prepare, and whatever is leftover saves well, so I get multiple meals from it! I share this recipe all the time and it will always be my go-to lasagna!” “Love this recipe,” says Juanita Garcia Wolff. “The only thing I changed to make it even more easier: I used oven-ready lasagna pasta and I did not add the water.” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 pound lean ground beef 1 (32 ounce) jar spaghetti sauce 32 ounces cottage cheese 3 cups shredded mozzarella cheese, divided 2 eggs ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese 2 teaspoons dried parsley salt to taste ground black pepper to taste 9 lasagna noodles ½ cup water Directions Gather all ingredients and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and discard grease. Stir in spaghetti sauce and simmer for 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine cottage cheese, 2 cups of mozzarella cheese, eggs, 1/2 of the grated Parmesan cheese, dried parsley, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spread 3/4 cup of sauce in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Cover with 3 uncooked lasagna noodles, 1 3/4 cups of cheese mixture, and 1/4 cup sauce; repeat layers once more. Top with remaining 3 noodles, sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan cheese. Pour 1/2 cup water along the edges of the dish. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Uncover and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,489 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 377 Calories 17g Fat 26g Carbs 29g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 377 % Daily Value * Total Fat 17g 21% Saturated Fat 8g 41% Cholesterol 90mg 30% Sodium 870mg 38% Total Carbohydrate 26g 10% Dietary Fiber 3g 9% Total Sugars 8g Protein 29g 59% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 332mg 26% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 463mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Lasagna 01 of 243 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 243 Photo by  DaringFrog5923 11/08/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Easy to make fool proof! The lasagna noodles I used didn’t require boiling, I do wonder if that made a difference as I added 1/2 cup water along the edges and it turned out great. I put pan on a cookie sheet but it didn’t bubble over. I accidentally put in too much mozzarella but I suspect no one would complain. Used stored bought sauce, tomato basil & garlic. Took the advice of another commenter here, baked covered for 50 instead of 40 minutes before removing the cover to bake again for 10 minutes. Happy with the result. I think this is a great base recipe covering the basics of how to make a lasagna with today’s resources and lifestyles, modifications are easily made to suit individual’s preferences, like which store bought sauce to use, different types of meat in the sauce etc.. overall, I’m happy with this! 03 of 243 Photo by  SneakyBrew2292 10/27/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Definitely easy to make and very yummy. I'll be doing less cheese and more sauce next time. And perhaps more Italian seasoning. 04 of 243 Photo by  BiggDaveUSA 10/27/2024 Lasagna came out great for a first try. I used a marinara sauce, but I should have went with a homemade sauce for a little more kick in flavor. I'm going to freeze half for single-serve week night meals. 05 of 243 Photo by  Cassie Cae 10/12/2024 I ended up putting more meat in the pan cause 1lb didn’t look like it was enough so I used 2 lbs. I just used a store brand spaghetti sauce and it was good however, next time I think I will get a sauce that’s more rich. I also started out layering by the measurements in the recipe, but again it was not enough meat for its layer. I ended up just doing equal amounts of everything while layering, used extra cheese, and threw a little cheddar on top as well! It’s a good and simple recipe. I’ll be making this again. 06 of 243 Photo by  Ricky 10/05/2024 OK with tweaks I used turkey meat instead of beef. It was good, but like most people said there was too much cheese mixture. I wonder if people were using 8 oz of cheese as indicated on a package rather than actually measuring 8 oz in a measuring cup. I did that and I found that 8 oz per the bag is way more than 8 oz in a measuring cup, so that could be it.I actually saw another recipe where it said to put the lasagna pieces in water to let them loosen up so I did that and it was just fine. The only thing I would do differently is maybe use ricotta cheese and reduce some of the liquid somehow because it was good, but in some places a little runny..maybe I could have drained the turkey meat a little better. Put the pan on a cookie sheet, it will spill over the top.. 07 of 243 Photo by  CyanBran7193 07/16/2024 A keeper! Easy is right, and so good. We have over 1/2 left(picture) for the freezer and another easy dinner 08 of 243 Photo by  Elwanda MsDivaa Vereen 07/16/2023 I haven’t made lasagna in a long time. I will layer the lasagna with the noodles first for the next time so I can have more sauce on top. It was good. 09 of 243 Photo by  shelby sullivan 01/08/2023 I tweaked the recipe a bit. Used two pounds of meat, more pasta sauce, cut out the water, added diced onion and seasonings (garlic powder, salt, pepper) while browning the meat. Also added minced garlic to the cheese mixture. I used more than 9 noodles (probably more like 12). Since I added extra stuff, I baked for about 45 min covered and 15 uncovered, and then let sit for another 10-15. Delicious! Might try shredded parm next time for even more of a melty cheese kick. I overflowed my casserole dish, but the lasagna came out great! 10 of 243 Photo by  jrfan82 12/26/2022 It was amazing, I made for my family for Christmas dinner..I added a little extra cheese and added mushrooms. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Classic and Simple Meat Lasagna 233 Ratings Slow Cooker Lasagna 1,063 Ratings Homemade Lasagna 390 Ratings Easy Lasagna with Uncooked Noodles 571 Ratings Grammy's Overnight Lasagna 83 Ratings Leftover Spaghetti Lasagna 70 Ratings Easy Spaghetti Pie 497 Ratings Skillet Lasagna 4 Ratings Cheesy Vegetable Lasagna 216 Ratings Spaghetti Pie 90 Ratings American Lasagna 2,736 Ratings Easy Lasagna Without Ricotta 8 Ratings Mexican Lasagna with Noodles 273 Ratings Instant Pot Lasagna 29 Ratings Sarah's Chicken Lasagna 35 Ratings Easy Skillet Lasagna 15 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
